ygData.subject: Truth is stranger than fiction.
ygData.msgSnippet: PHobia peeked around the corner checking up on KitKat, she seemed to have the most leadership qualities, but didn t seem to be very easily manipulated. I agree

PHobia peeked around the corner checking up on KitKat, she seemed to 
have the most leadership qualities, but didn't seem to be very easily 
manipulated.

I agree completely, "no bot deserves severe punishment for a mistake"-
 he didn't hear the whole conversation but he'd heard enough to lead 
into a salespitch. "Even if the mistake was following the wrong 
leader." he'd hoped the two bots would understand his words without 
him accually saying them.

"If say Oh I don't know Kit Kat here for example led a successful 
mission against a powerful enemy then The leader in question would 
lose merit." he paused looking back and forth between the two. "Then 
she or whomever the case was would get the prestige, the publicity, 
it may even reach the other Predacons and unite them against a common 
foe."

If his words didn't convince her he'd have to result to the facts he 
had, all he had to do was twist the facts the right way.

-- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::KitKat:;
> 
> "No, one should die just because one made a mistake.  You should 
> learn from your mistake and try not to make the same mistake over 
and 
> over again.  Just because you think you make a bad choice, that 
> doesn't mean you should be punnished for it."
> 
> 
> 
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, "THECODE" <thecode@p...> wrote:
> > Land Mine sighed.
> > 
> > "You see, if I don't punish me then who will? I failed as a 
Predacon
> > already, I cannot believe it, after all of that work back of 
> Cybertron."
> > Land Mine said. She didn't feel good and KitKat wasn't helping by 
> confusing
> > her. Shouldn't one die for actions done wrong?
> > 
> > "KitKat, shouldn't one die for actions done wrong? I did alot 
wrong,
> > including my Grammar and my treating of our leader, I'm sorry." 
> Land Mine
> > said. She took the knife back.
> > 
> > "When i die, make sure this knife goes with me." She said before 
> putting the
> > knife away...
